info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 5:41PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTY THROUGH 615 PM MDT... At 541 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Elkins, or 25 miles northeast of Roswell, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Elkins. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
